title: Ruins of the Abbey of Rijnsburg, Large Version
titles: Ruins of the Abbey of Rijnsburg from the South: Large Version
description: Grote versie van de ruïne van de abdij van Rijnsburg. Staand bij de ruïne een man en een aantal schapen.

acquisition.creditLine: Transferred from the Koninklijke Bibliotheek (The Hague), 1816

physicalMedium: line etching with tone and highlights created by the use of crosshatching and stopping-out with lines left blank, intended specifically for printing in light-coloured ink on a darker surface, printed in yellowish white (lead-tin yellow) on paper prepared with a black ground, coloured with opaque blue paint and opaque red paint
longTitle: Ruins of the Abbey of Rijnsburg, Large Version, Hercules Segers, c. 1625 - c. 1630
subTitle: h c.193mm × w c.315mm
scLabelLine: line etching with tone and highlights in yellow-white, on a dark brown ground, coloured with the brush, varnished, only state, c. 1625–1630

label.title: Ruins of the Abbey of Rijnsburg, Large Version
label.makerLine: line etching with tone and highlights in yellow-white, on a dark brown ground, coloured with the brush, varnished, only state, c. 1625–1630
label.description: Here the rocks are painted red and the sky blue. The interplay of the printed yellowish white lines and the overpainting yielded a hybrid artwork, a cross between a painting and a print. The varnish was applied later and has browned in the course of time.
